meanings.definition: The act of removing tangles or complications from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully performed the disentanglement of the knots in her necklace.
meanings.sent2: After hours of patient work, the disentanglement of the fishing net was finally complete.
meanings.sent3: The disentanglement of the yarn resembled a magician untangling a never-ending scarf.
meanings.sent4: His disentanglement of the legal case was like unraveling a complex mystery.
meanings.sent5: The disentanglement of the vines in the garden required precision and care.

meanings.definition: The state of being free from entanglement or confusion.
meanings.sent1: Her mind felt a sense of relief and clarity after the disentanglement of her thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The disentanglement of the wires on his desk made the workspace much neater.
meanings.sent3: The disentanglement of the traffic jam was a sight to behold, like a synchronized dance of cars.
meanings.sent4: The disentanglement of the plot in the story revealed a surprising twist.
meanings.sent5: The disentanglement of the puzzle pieces brought a satisfying sense of completion.
